# RadioDet? Source Epoch Distance ### Frequency Flux RMS ### XrayDet? LowE Flux FluxError1 Fluxerror2 ### Spin(Hz) B(G) Bmeasurement? Orbit(hour) ### IncludeInPlot ### Alpha dAlpha
#
# Orbit, spin and B: -1 means unknown
# Type: 1 == strong B, slow spin; 2 == weak B, fast spin
# We assume that the maximum X-ray energy is always set to 10 keV. The minimum value given is also in keV.
# Bmeasurement: 1 means an actual measured value. 0 means an estimate. -1 means an upper limit. 
# Note: a negative X-ray flux means that we have to use 10**FLUX to get the actual value. 
# Also: if the two flux errors are negative, those are min and max values. For positive values, the second is simple zero and the error is the uncertainty. 
# An X-ray flux upper limit is at 3 sigma. 
# dAlpha: > 0 means error, -1 means 3 sigma UL, 0 means no measurement
#
# Distance updates: sources with updates (Jan 2021) are: 4U 1954, 2A 1822, Her X-1, 1E 1145, Cen X-3, 4U 1538, 4U 1700, Vela X-1, V*V490 Cep, MXB 0656, SAX J2239, V0332.
#
